thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: MetLife Will Take Over Pensions for 41,000 FedEx Retirees

author: Leslie Scism
title: MetLife Will Take Over Pensions for 41,000 FedEx Retirees
text:
MetLife Inc. has reached an agreement with FedEx Corp. to take responsibility for about $6 billion of pension payments to approximately 41,000 retirees and beneficiaries, one of the biggest risk-transfer deals for U.S. life insurers in recent years.
The transaction is smaller than Prudential Financial Inc.â€™s groundbreaking $25 billion transaction in 2012 to oversee pensions for 110,000 General Motors Co. retirees. It also is smaller than a $8.4 billion transaction that same year in which Prudential began paying pensions of...
